triples.name: Random forest
triples.relevance: Random forests are the primary ensemble machine learning method described in the paper for classification and regression tasks.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is the foundational field within which random forests and the paper's techniques operate.

triples.name: Statistical classification
triples.relevance: Classification is one of the primary applications of random forests discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Predictive analytics
triples.relevance: Forecasting and prediction are key applications of random forests mentioned throughout the paper.

triples.name: Decision tree
triples.relevance: Decision trees are the fundamental building blocks that random forests aggregate to make predictions.

triples.name: Pattern recognition
triples.relevance: Pattern recognition is listed as an application of random forests for identifying meaningful patterns in data.

triples.name: Supervised learning
triples.relevance: Supervised learning is the learning paradigm used by random forests to train on labeled data.

triples.name: Overfitting
triples.relevance: Overfitting is a key problem that random forests address through training multiple trees on random data subsets.
